name: The Legislature - for Photographers
description: Photography tour of Victoria's Legislative grounds. This 12 ½ acre property has served as a site of government in British Columbia since 1864. The style of the Parliament Buildings has been described as ‘free classical’ and ‘Romanesque. The buildings and grounds are a photographers dream come true. Whether you are a new at photography, or accomplished, this tour will show you the sides of the property that usually go unexplored by the tourist. In addition to the magnificent Parliament Buildings, the Legislative precinct is home to numerous landmarks  and many beautiful fountains, trees, and gardens. Including: the Cenotaph, the Premiers Rose Garden, Centennial Fountain, the 'red buildings' and of course, the Legislature itself .
